title: Old Florida -- 1970 -- Great Lunch
text: Nice local place with good food and staff. Enjoyed a wonderful lunch from the outside upper bar overlooking the canal.

title: Wonderful Air-Boat Ride
text:
Our first air-boat ride. There were four of us and everyone enjoyed the trip. Great guide. Pleasant hour on the river. Great value at $45 per person. We saw alligators, bird life, and a beautiful river.

We would do this again.

title: Inconsistant
text:
Excellent Cornbread Madelines ($6). Very good roasted carrots ($7). Jack Daniels BBQ Beans A++.

Sliced pastrami plate ($16) only OK, a bit too much fat (and yes, there should be some fat) that washed out the pastrami flavor. Ray's famous Italian Beef sandwich ($14) was good. Big Wedgie Salad was good ($14). Overall, the mains weren't memorable.

Dinner for four was $129.

Good service, but slow kitchen. Good atmosphere. Decent parking for downtown.

title: Excellent Modern Urban Park
text:
Excellent example of modern urban public park.

Lots of open space for walking and viewing. Restaurants, ice cream, and a small area of craft stalls. Adjacent to marina. Nice view of skylines and airport. Public art. Great splash pad for kids. Great playground. A small beach. Festive atmosphere. Fishing spot at the end of the pier. Nice small museum by Tampa Bay Watch.

A nice place to stroll, sit, and relax. A good spot to bring kids.

Clean. Shuttles. Parking is OK.

More cities should invest in public spaces such as this.

title: Better than last time.
text:
We had dinner here - outside on the sidewalk. Enjoyed the food more than last time.

I had the Margharita Pizza ($14). Very good. Thin crust, but a little doughy. Also at the table Tagliatelle alle Bolognese ($17) served only warm, not hot from the kitchen. Also Ravioli al Formaggio -- very good ($19), and a Prosciutto Cotto Pizza with Arugula ($18). The Ricotta Meatballs (Meatballs, sauce, and little balls of ricotta cheese) was excellent ($11).

We all enjoyed the wine -- a bottle of "Conundrum" ($41), a red blend from California. We recommend.

Good service. Dinner for four $147. We will come back.

title: Causal Outdoor Dinning -- Ok Food
text:
We had dinner here. The fish spread appetizer is very good. The rest of the meal was average at best. Probably a better place for drinks and an appetizer or two, than for dinner. Excellent location and atmosphere.

Slow kitchen. Long wait for food.

I had the chicken tenders sandwich (Island Time Dockwhich - $14) and fries. Boring.
We had the grilled street corn ($7.50) and was OK, but I think they boiled it first.

Service was average.

Plastic cups for beer and cocktails.

I won't rush back, but I might give it a second chance.

title: Great Lunch Spot
text:
We had lunch here. Four people $112. Food was good, but not excellent or outstanding. However it exceeded expectations for a place with such a good view/location. High end pub food.

I had a Mojo Pork Sandwich ($11). Around the table was Fish Tacos ($14), Grouper Sandwich ($20), and Tropical Salad with Blacken Mahi ($23). Everyone satisfied.

Lightly battered or breaded french fries -- not my favorite.

Nice outdoor seating with great views. Live music. Good Service.

They serve drinks in plastic cups with plastic straws. I would prefer real glasses for look and feel, as well as environmental reasons. Use paper straws for the cocktails instead of plastic.

We will return.
place: Doc Ford's Rum Bar & Grille - St. Pete

title: Nothing Special - Poor Value
text:
Rumfish is dated and worn. The hotel and grounds lack good flow and function. For instance, you walk to the Rumfish restaurant through parking garage traffic or backing delivery trucks -- no walkway. The path to beach front is down a dark hall or around the edge of the building on a narrow path between the wall and the fence.

Don't forget to figure in the extra $45/day activity fee when you price your room. Read careful what it includes and if you are actually going to use much of it. The things we tend use the most are free at a Holiday Inn Express -- towels, pool, WiFi, movies, exercise room, and such.

Mixed experience with the staff. Check-in (late at night) was excellent. Check-out at 8AM was awful --- one person at the desk with a line where some people needed 10 minutes of help and others only a minute. When we tried to ask at the office if we really needed to check-out in person we were barked at to get back in line. How about online check out????

Security theater at the front gate, and the night security officer was 350 pounds in a white shirt with a badge.

Mattress was uncomfortable. Sheets rough. Towels excellent. Room furnishings old. Marginally clean -- air vents full of dust, corners full dust, etc. Your typical Holiday Inn Express is 100% better for comfort and the condition of the room.

Free generic, unbranded coffee (as part of the $45 daily fee) in your room, or $4.50 coffee in the grill.

Cabana's come with the $45 fee, but the online system to reserve them doesn't work so your reservation isn't real. (Cabana staff says it hasn't worked for months.) You must physically present yourself the day before at 2PM to get a cabana. And, cabana's with a view of the water are $15 extra.

I won't go back. Not a good value. Failed to meet expectations. St. Pete Beach is great, but it is the same beach no matter which place you stay at.

title: It felt different and slipping.....but still good seafood.
text:
We had fish sandwiches, an order of cole slaw, and two sodas ($38). It was slow getting our food and they weren't overly busy (empty tables inside and out). The fish was very good and we enjoyed our sandwiches. (But we thought they used to come with lettuce & tomato -- they don't.) The cole slaw was boring. The french fries not great, just OK.

You order at the window, pay, find a table and they call name.

Clean. Window staff very good.

Parking is tough -- we park at the Kittery Trading Post, walk over for lunch, and then shop at the Trading Post.

title: Great Ice Cream & Hot Dogs
text:
We stopped for dinner & ice cream. We had Texas Hot Wieners ($2 each) with their "secret sauce" and Shoe String Fries ($3.25) each. Nicely done.

The ice cream was big winner. A small soft serve ($2.25) and a Regular Size Mint Sundae Special ($3.95) with mint chocolate chip ice cream, oreos, hot fudge, whipped cream, cherry and sprinkles.

Classic old school roadside ice cream joint. Excellent value.

And, they have Vegan Ice Cream and Shakes.

We will return.

title: Good Lunch -- Lots of Things to Lots of People
text:
I had a tuna melt ($10,50), a soda and chips for lunch. I've had coffee here in the past. Its fine for lunch and you won't be unhappy, but nothing special. The kitchen is slow for what they make.

They are covering a lot of bases here -- bakery, coffee shop, lunch stop, entertainment & events (story slam, open mic, music, etc.) --- so its hard to rate them across all their roles -- so I'm limiting my rating to stopping in for lunch.

Lots of outdoor dinning. Good COVID protocols and procedures.

title: Great Sandwiches, Take-Out
text:
I eat lunch here twice a week. They make excellent Sandwiches - made to order or from a list of standards. All Sandwiches are $9.50. They usually have two soups (or a chili). The buffalo mac & cheese is great. All the usual chips, sodas, and other drinks you would expect at a village store.

This is mostly a take-out restaurant. There are some picnic tables outside. They serve breakfast and lunch. You order at the counter and pay at the register. Plenty of parking.

They make a good breakfast sandwich -- English muffin, egg, cheese, and bacon.

Basic coffee -- no cappuccino or specialty items.

Friendly service.

Also serves as the Village convenience store for basic items.

title: Good Coffee House -- Good Lunch Spot
text:
We had lunch here. The food was good and you won't be disappointed. Pretty normal sandwich shop fare and breakfast fare that is well done. Full range of coffee items. Beats going to any of the chain restaurants.

I had a Rueben sandwich. It was average. Sandwiches are about $8 to $10.

Service was good.

Lots of space inside and lots of distance between tables. Outside seating also. You order and pay at the counter.

I would go back.

title: Coffee and Breakfast Sandwich
text:
We stopped here for breakfast on a Sunday morning. We had coffee and breakfast sandwiches on a bagel. No cappuccino..... just regular coffees -- dark, medium & light. Good bagel -- it held up well as a breakfast sandwich (not soggy).

They are primarily a bakery, not a restaurant. You won't go wrong with coffee and pastry or a bagel for breakfast.

Pastries looked great.

Average pricing. Service a bit disjointed, but friendly and not too bad -- they could use an operations expert -- there layout and systems makes the staff bump about too much and overlap with each other.....

title: Best of Fast Food Asian
text:
We had take-out diner. I had a rice bowl with pork and an egg. It is about $11. Lots of flavor to it and good ingredients. I would go back.

Good value -- filling.

Drive-up take-out only at the moment. Order online and drive up to the window at the appointed time.

They have a second location in New Paltz, but not part of a larger chain. A similar concept to Chipotle, but I liked it much better.

title: Great Burritos
text:
We had lunch from Bubby's - a Brisket Burrito, a Chorizo Burrito & a Stand Burrito. We all enjoyed them and would return. The Stand Burrito is a traditional Burrito. Chorizo and Brisket made for a flavorful variation.

Burritos are $9 each.

Mostly a take-out place (and all take-out during the pandemic). There are picnic tables around the corner at the center of town.

title: Classic Fried Seafood, Outdoor Dockside Dinning
text:
Excellent fried seafood. We pulled off I-95 and had lunch here. I had the whole clam roll, small onion rings and a root beer float. I would order this again. Plenty of clams. The batter is nicely done and not too greasy.

Your basic stand in line, order at the window seafood shack. Lots of outdoor seating, some under a pavilion. Nice view of the harbor and marina. Decent parking.

Lunch for two people was $47.36 (including a $5 tip).

There was a long line, but it moved reasonably fast, and the wait for your order was OK.

We would eat here again.

title: A Lot of Effort for A Coffee & Bagel
text: We stopped (3 of us) for Coffee & Bagels. First we stood in line (inside) to pay, then we had to go outside to order the coffee, then back inside to a counter to order the bagels. We sat outside a table on the sidewalk. We had go back in to the counter to find our bagels. The coffee came out to us. We had to go back inside to dispose of trash....... all of this seems to be part of their COVID routine. Coffee & Bagels were fine. The price was right. Nice old market. Good selection of specialty items and basics. Maybe locals know the system.... the staff wasn't overly helpful and seemed annoyed at questions.

title: Good Bourbon, Good Food Truck -- Overall Experience Lacking
text:
The Flore Food Truck on-site was very good. The distillery was OK. There bourbon is very good.

They sell premixed drinks from a dispenser or you can buy them premixed in bottles. They are OK at best. Buy their bourbon and mix your own drinks.

We came at lunch time, we got drinks and a cheese/cracker plate from the distillery. We got lunch from the food truck. Outdoor dinning.

No real engagement from the staff.

I would buy their bourbon again and I would get take-out from the food truck again, but I don't think I'd go for the experience of drinking/dinning there again.

title: Fun Way to Spend an Afternoon
text:
Did a tasting of three of their products -- two bourbons and one gin. Excellent products. The staff were knowledgeable, attentive and fun. We bought a bourbon and a gin for us, and we got maple bourbon for a friend.

We also purchased their Bourbon Maple Syrup, an item we've had before. Wonderful on pancakes.

Peaceful, pastoral setting. Lots of parking. Taste three items for $15. Small bags of chips available, but no food or snacks -- the only weakness.

We will go back.

title: Burger & Beer Joint.....Very Good
text:
We had lunch here. Burgers & Beer - I had the Philly Cheese Burger. Very good burger ($12). A full list of sandwiches, wraps & burgers all int he $12 range. Choice of salad or fries with your burger. Very good service and value.

They have outdoor dining. It's within walking distance of the center of town.

We would go back.

title: Excellent German Food
text:
We had dinner here. The food was excellent. Outdoor dining.

I had jaeger schnitzel - $22. We had German draft beers and cider. We had the giant pretzel ($9) and potato pancakes ($8). We had ice cream and Strudel ($9). Dinner for three was $175 -- we splurged with appetizers, drinks and dessert.

Service was excellent.

They have a children's menu.

We will go back.

title: Throw-Back to Another Era (1939)- Great Burgers
text:
Under New Management as of August 2020 & they seem to have preserved what everyone liked about the White Hut. Simple menu and good food.

We had lunch here. Burgers and Cheeseburgers with fries and onion rings. Burgers with fried onions is the signature dish and has been for the 50 or so years I've been coming. At the moment, the inside counter is closed, so its takeout or a few outside tables (we did takeout). The day we came, the milk shake machine was not in service.

Great service and value. Hamburger is $3.75, a cheeseburger is $4.00, and a hot dog is $3.75. Fries are $3 and onion rings $3.50.

The burgers are fried on a grill top with onions. They are very good. The fries are average. The onion rings above average.

Well staffed to move the the lunch line.

I look forward to returning.

Parking is tight.

They do breakfast, but I've never been here for breakfast.

title: A Giant Art Installation
text:
The life's work of a single artist who created a sculpture of slate covering acres. You walk through a park like setting and observe the sculpture from an infinite number of angles and locations. Quiet & relaxing.

You need reservations (online) due to pandemic protocols. Parities of 5 or smaller and you are limited to 2 hours.

$11 to visit or $8 for students/seniors.

title: Still Excellent Food & Excellent Value
text:
The food is excellent -- hot dogs & burgers. We had dinner here and we had the Dallas Hot Wieners - their signature hot dog with a special sauce, onion and mustard. We also had french fries. The Dallas Hot Wieners are only $2 each. A giant bag of shoestring fries is $3.

Best priced food around. Dinner for three was about $22.

Service was excellent. The place is clean.

No outdoor dining, so we did take-out and tailgated in the parking lot. (They should put a few picnic tables outside.)

title: Wow!
text:
Don't miss this. We saw a billboard near Hudson for this and stopped, and were glad we did. Excellent sculpture park. The best we've seen.

Multiple fields of sculpture. What you see when you drive in is only the tip of the iceberg. Plan on 3 hours of strolling around the property and viewing the art.

A bit off the beaten path. Plenty of Parking. The visitor center and cafe is closed due to the pandemic, so there are no facilities or gift shop at the moment.

No charge. Bikes and dogs allowed.

title: Typical Drive-In -- Meets Expectations
text:
We had lunch here. Chili Dogs, Chicken Wraps, Fries, Onion Rings, and Milkshakes. The Chili Dog was very good. The Onion Rings were only OK -- nothing great -- kind of commercial. The rest was as expected and good.

We would get lunch here again.

Outdoor dinning. Plenty of Parking. Average Prices.

title: Still Excellent
text:
Famous for their seafood chowder and blueberry muffing (they come together), and they are still excellent. It's been maybe a decade since we visited and were happy to find the experience was as good as we expected. Cup of chowder and muffin are $9.

The Haddock Sandwich was also excellent ($12) and came with homemade potato chips. We very good calamari ($12).

We came by boat for lunch. They have plenty of spots to tie-up a boat if you come this way. Outdoor dinning on picnic tables with views of the bay.

Average service. Good Value -- lunch for five was $116.

title: Excellent Sandwiches
text:
They roast and hand cut their roast beef, turkey and other meats so the cuts are thick and juicy. I had "The Henry VIII" -- roast beef with horseradish and sour cream $8.50). Very good chickpea salad and potato salad ($3).

Outdoor dining at picnic tables.

Good service and value.

Tight parking lot. At the northern edge of the Kittery commercial strip on Route 1.

title: Good Corned Beef
text:
I gave it a Very Good rating on the basis of its corned beef -- lean and flavorful. Better corned beef than I find elsewhere on the Cape. Otherwise a pretty typical lunch spot. You won't go wrong. Good spot to feed the kids.

Average service. Average Value.

Some outdoor dining at picnic tables. Easy parking.

I would stop here again.

title: Drinks & Appetizers
text:
We came with a group of 9, and had drinks and appetizers to share. The appetizers were excellent. Fresh, quality ingredients. Lots of flavor.

We visit every summer. So far, nothing else has drawn us away.

Service is excellent.

You need reservations (Pandemic Precautions) because they have only two cafe tables outside, and so they need to space out dinning inside. (They are doing take-out.)

Easy to find - Right on Main Street in Downtown Rangeley.
place: Forks in the Air Mountain Bistro

title: Family Fun
text:
Par 3 Golf on a homemade golf course. Not for serious golfers. $10 for adults and $5 for kids. No staff. You put your money in a slot in a barrel.

You don't need clubs but bring tees and golf balls. There is an old bus full of old clubs and golf bags you can sort through and borrow.

Family fun. Great place to teach kids to golf or just hack around. No crowds.

Sort of in the middle of nowhere. Lots of mosquitoes - bring bug spray.

We always play a round whenever we visit Rangeley. About a 20 minute ride from downtown Rangeley, with potential moose viewing along the way.

title: Fun For All
text:
Excellent Overall Experience. Great for large groups and families. Good way to spend an afternoon or an evening.

It's a bowling alley -- the big balls (not candlepin). It is also a bar, a pool hall, a lounge, and an arcade. The arcade is currently closed as part of the pandemic protocols.

The lounge area is a big round indoor fire pit with big comfy chairs. Plenty of beer on the tap. You can order drinks and food delivered to your bowling lane.

One weakness is the food. Its below average or barely average bar food. Ok for snacks and beer and bowling. The nachos are pretty good. The pizza is super thin and I'm guessing frozen/microwaved or something.

Easy to find on Main Street in Rangeley and plenty of parking.

We go at least once every year -- a group of 12 adults and teens.

title: Great Lunch & View - Slow
text:
We had lunch here. The place exceeds expectations because it looks terrible from the road. Due to the pandemic, the inside dinning areas are closed and all dinning is on a great deck in the rear. The deck has a great view of the lake and sits up high over the landscape. Typical tables, plastic chairs and umbrellas.

I had a Lobster BLT -- very good --- $20. I would have this again. It is two thick slices of toast, mayo, bacon, lettuce & tomato. It comes with fries.

My daughter had the "The Bomb Burger" -- $12. It's a burger with bacon, mozzarella sticks and honey bourbon sauce. She liked it.

Service was very slow. This is where the dining experience really fell down.

I would come again in hopes the service is better. I enjoyed the sandwich and view enough to give another go.

title: Still a Good Lunch Spot
text:
I had lunch here. A small Italian Sub with everything. Typical soft sub roll. Better than average.

Good value. Small Italian Sub is $6.50.

Lots of parking and easy to visit. It's in a shopping plaza. Open for take-out (pandemic protocols).

title: Great Architecture -- A 10 minute stop to walk around.
text:
Great house and worth taking a 10-minute walk around. Its on the way to Fort Hill and you can easily walk to it from the first Fort Hill Parking Lot.

The house wasn't open when we visited. There was no signage to indicate any hours it might be open or tours are given.

It's a beautiful house and the architecture is well worth checking out. But, its only a 10-minute visit. The historical markers are OK.

title: Great Lighthouse & History -- Good Views
text:
A beautiful lighthouse. I can't help stopping to look at this lighthouse whenever I'm in the area. Good history. Currently closed for tours. This is an operating lighthouse.

Nice views of the beach and Atlantic Ocean from the viewing platform between the lighthouse and cliff overlooking the beach. You can see Provincetown and you can see the Jenny Lind Tower.

Parking is limited (free). The grounds are open at night. It is surrounded by a golf course.

title: Typical Views for the Area. Weak on History.
text:
Typical views of the Outer Cape Beaches and Atlantic Ocean with a bit of history thrown in. Views and site are not unlike other sites in the area. Well worth a 20 minute stop.

Historical markers are only OK -- they could do better.

Nothing really left of the Marconi Wireless Structures. Its just a viewing platform, some historical markers and great views of the ocean.

Easy to visit. Plenty of Parking.

title: Easy Walks and Beautiful Views
text:
Easy, family friendly hiking/walking trails. Not as crowded as other sites in area. Beautiful ocean views. Meadows & wildflowers. Site of ancient Nauset Indian encampment -- now marked as "Indian Rock" - a grinding rock for making knives and arrowheads.

Two small parking lots off Fort Hill Road and some additional access at the town landing (Hemenway Road). Signage OK.

Also, check out the Penniman House near the first parking lot.

You can do a short walk of 15 to 20 minutes or spend two-hours here. Lots of walking options.

title: Excellent Spot for Coffee & Croissant
text:
I had coffee and a chocolate croissant for breakfast. It was as good as what I've experienced in France.

I sat outside at small table on the sidewalk. I'd put having coffee and a croissant here into the hidden-gem category. I wish I they were near my home! Note, all they serve is coffee and croissant, and of course chocolates which what they are really known for.

They are a small franchise.

I look forward to another visit.

title: Great Breakfast
text:
We had breakfast here. I had corned beef hash and eggs ($10). Very good. Good Value. It's a small locally owned restaurant. Very Good Service.

Its not on the beach, its right on Gulf Blvd across from the Plaza Beach Motel.

We we return.

title: Fried & Grilled Seafood, Drinks, Loud
text:
We were a group 14. This is a good place for large group. The seafood is better than you would expect in a place with large tables, a big bar, a large loud crowd, and on the beach.

I had the boiled seafood dinner -- shrimp, corn, potatoes, and french fries. Basic, but everything was done right. Others had fried Grouper and enjoyed it. Excellent Cesar Salad.

Mid-range price. Very good service.

We will return.

title: Very Good Traditional Pizza
text:
We got six large pizzas for take-out. Two each of cheese, pepperoni, and vegetables. Good sauce and not so too much cheese (so as to overwhelm the other flavors). A traditional or typical dough and crust.

It's located in the Publix Plaza near the entrance to the Maximo Neighborhood.

Good service. $106 for all six pizzas.

We will go back.

title: Good Food - Weak Service
text:
This is at Tampa Airport. I ordered a Grilled Chicken Sandwich, Tots & a Soda. (About $8) I got a fried chicken sandwich instead. It wasn't what I wanted, but it was good -- in particular, the lettuce and tomato were fresh. The tots were average.

Service was a bit slow. Good value for airport food.

title: OK....Nothing Great --- Nothing Bad
text:
We had dinner here. I had a burger. It was average pub burger fare. Service was average. $60 for dinner & 4 drinks for 4 adults.

Service was average. Lots of parking.

I wouldn't go out of my way to go back, but I won't resist it if someone wanted to go and get lunch or dinner here. It's comfy. It's Ok.

title: Good Pub Food for Chain
text:
We had dinner here. It's a chain. Compared to chain restaurants I rate this above average, mainly on the strength of dinner. I had the Steak & Ale Pie ($14.99). It comes with cheddar mashed potatoes and vegetables. It's got flavor and its not too salty the way many commercial foods are. The cheddar mashed potatoes were good, but no hint of cheddar.

Average to good value. Above average service. Lots of parking.

My experience with this chain is that the food is consistent from location to location.

I will go back.

title: Good Pub Food
text:
We had dinner here. Three pizzas shared by 4 adults. These are personal size pizzas (10" - 11"). A pepperoni ($13), a fig & prosciutto ($15) and an onion & mushroom ($12). Not a traditional pizza style - a bit trendy, but very good. Lots of flavor -- nothing bland. Crust could have been more crisp.

Great atmosphere. Very good service. Average pub value (dinner & drinks for 4 $90).

Parking is difficult. We parked in town and walked up.

I would go back.

title: View Beats the Food
text:
We had dinner here. I had Lobster Fra Diavolo ($38). Not great. The sauce was dull and soupy. The bluefish pate with our appetizer was excellent, the tempura was very good, and the salmon was dull. Overall, the meal wasn't good. Tourist food with a view --- you paying for the view.

Service was very good. The view/location is excellent. There was live music in the bar that was good. Without the music, the noise level in the restaurant is high. Good parking.

I didn't like the way the Lobster Fra Diavolo was prepared (in addition to the bad sauce) and presented. It is essentially a tight ball of linguini in a soup of tomato sauce with a boiled lobster on top. It also had clams in shell, mussels in shell, and shrimp with the tails on. A super mess to eat. To my mind, Lobster Fra Diavolo doesn't require you to pick your lobster meat from the shell dripping with tomato sauce. You should add the lobster meat to the sauce in the pan just before it is mixed with the linguini. The same for the other seafood items. I don't want to pick my shrimp out of the sauce to take the tails off. I want to eat the pasta, sauce, and lobster all as a single dish.

If someone invited me to join them for drinks and an appetizer to enjoy the view, I'd go. But, I'm not looking to come back for dinner.

title: Wood Fired Pizza
text:
Wood fired pizza is their thing and its good, but not the best. Decent by Cape Cod standards. I found the crust to be a bit soft for wood fired. I had the sopressata pizza ($14.50). The sopressata was very good.

Six pizzas, wine and one appetizer was $138.

Service was above average.

title: It's OK
text:
I had lunch here. I had a small "495 Wreck" -- pastrami & corned beef sandwich. It was average. I had an order of fries (big enough for 2 or 3) and they were average.

The restaurant is in a strip mall space with plenty of parking and easy access to/from I-495 or RT 110.

Service was good. Average value.

title: Mixed Feelings -- Great Beer v Average Food
text:
I had dinner here with a large group. They make their own beer and do it well. The food is average pub food. Very good staff.

This a big loud place that's suitable for anyone. They are heavy into their own merchandising. The atmosphere is old pub on two levels.

title: Clean & Comfortable
text:
I stayed one night. My room was clean & comfortable. This hotel follows the standard template of its class and does it well. The front desk staff was very good.

I didn't get a chance to try the breakfast because I left before it opened at 7AM on a Saturday. I think it opens at 6AM on weekdays.

The lobby is a level up when you walk in from the parking lot.

I would stay here again.

title: Best of Pub Food
text:
We've been eating here for 40 years. The food is consistently good. Great pub atmosphere - comfortable. Excellent service. Good value.

I had steak frites with gorgonzola ($19). We had the fried Brussel sprouts appetizer. They have the full range of pub food appetizers and burgers, as well as comfort food -- Shepard's Pie, Mac & Cheese dishes, and Brisket.

We will eat here again.

title: Great Spot for a Slice
text:
We had lunch here. Two slices and a soda. Lots of variety of pizza types from the traditional to non-traditional. The place was packed. Seating is tight. It does a huge take-out business. One of the busiest spots on the block.

We will go back.

title: Everything You Need
text:
Clean. Good front desk staff. Comfortable - Quiet. Good value. Bright lobby and halls.

We stayed one night. Breakfast is included and is the typical free breakfast fare. It's hard to ask any more of hotel at this price point. It's as good as gets.

15 Minute walk to the center of Northampton. Easy access off I-91.

We'll stay here again.

title: Burgers & Beer
text:
We had dinner here. It is typical of a lot of newer trendy pubs. Good for burgers & beer. I had a burger and it was fine ($14). Nothing outstanding.

Good service. Good value. $104 for four people.

title: Its All About the View.....
text:
A Five Star View and Two Star Experience. We came for drinks and appetizers. The drinks were OK (most drinks are -- its hard to get them too wrong), but the appetizers seemed commercial -- nothing great.

Service was OK. Pricey, you are paying for view and rooftop location.

If you are coming up for the view and a drink before diner, its fine. But, go somewhere else for food.

title: Authentic
text:
Its a breakfast joint -- an authentic joint.... Loud, a bit messy.

Great breakfast food. I had eggs with corned beef hash and grits. Very good tasting. All the breakfast foods you can imagine.

Great value. Five people for breakfast for $55.

I will return.

title: Doesn't Stand Out
text:
We had dinner here. It as OK. No problems. The food was typical and nothing about it makes me want to rush back. If someone invited us to dine here, I'd be fine with it.

I had a personal pizza. It is wood oven pizza with a thin crust. It just didn't stand out.

Service was average. We ate outside on the sidewalk. Nice setting.

Dinner for five was $112.

title: Italian Comfort Food
text:
I had lunch here with a large group. We didn't call ahead and they were great figuring out how to seat us all.

This is Italian Comfort Food. It's hot, its large portions, its traditional, and it's excellent. I had pizza. We shared a wonderful antipasto.

Casual, old school spot. Great value - Lunch for 10 was $148. Great Service.

Next time I'm in the area, I'll be going back.
